message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The medication targets beta-1 adrenergic receptors, suggesting that it is a beta-1 agonist. Among the options, only Dobutamine is a selective beta-1 agonist that is commonly used in acute decompensated heart failure, with its efficacy decreasing within one week due to receptor downregulation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Dobutamine is a medication that targets beta-1 adrenergic receptors preferentially over beta-2 adrenergic receptors and is commonly used for short-term treatment of acute decompensated congestive heart failure. Its efficacy decreases within one week due to receptor downregulation. Epinephrine and norepinephrine stimulate both beta-1 and beta-2 adrenergic receptors, while isoproterenol stimulates both beta-1 and beta-2 adrenergic receptors equally.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The medication prescribed targets beta-1 adrenergic receptors preferentially over beta-2 adrenergic receptors and its efficacy decreases within one week due to receptor downregulation. Among the options, only dobutamine fits these criteria. It is a beta-1 adrenergic receptor agonist used in acute heart failure that can cause tachycardia and has a short half-life due to receptor downregulation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, dobutamine is the only medication that targets beta-1 adrenergic receptors preferentially over beta-2 adrenergic receptors, making it the most likely medication to have been prescribed for acute decompensated congestive heart failure. Its efficacy decreases within one week due to receptor down-regulation, which is why the physician explained that it would only be used temporarily. Epinephrine activates both beta-1 and beta-2 adrenergic receptors, while isoproterenol activates both beta-1 and beta-2 adrenergic receptors as well as alpha adrenergic receptors, making them less suitable for this patient's condition. Norepinephrine primarily activates alpha adrenergic receptors so it is also an unlikely option.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The medication prescribed targets beta-1 adrenergic receptors and is used for acute decompensated heart failure, indicating that it is a positive inotropic agent. Among the options, only dobutamine is a beta-1 adrenergic receptor agonist and is used for short-term treatment of heart failure. Isoproterenol can target both beta-1 and beta-2 receptors, while epinephrine and norepinephrine target both alpha and beta receptors.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The medication prescribed targets beta-1 adrenergic receptors, which are found in the heart, and is used to temporarily improve heart function in CHF patients. Among the options, only Dobutamine targets beta-1 adrenergic receptors explicitly, and it is commonly used to improve cardiac output in acute decompensated congestive heart failure. Epinephrine and Norepinephrine are used to treat acute hypotension, and Isoproterenol is used to treat certain types of heart rhythm disturbances.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Dobutamine is a medication that targets beta-1 adrenergic receptors and is commonly used to treat decompensated congestive heart failure. Its efficacy decreases within one week due to receptor downregulation, making it a temporary medication. Epinephrine and norepinephrine are both non-selective adrenergic agonists, while isoproterenol primarily targets beta-2 adrenergic receptors. None of these medications are commonly used to treat decompensated congestive heart failure.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The medication prescribed targets beta-1 adrenergic receptors and is used for acute decompensated congestive heart failure. This medication is temporary because its efficacy decreases within one week due to receptor downregulation. Among the options, Dobutamine is the only medication that targets beta-1 adrenergic receptors preferentially over beta-2 adrenergic receptors and is used for acute decompensated congestive heart failure.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Dobutamine targets beta-1 adrenergic receptors preferentially over beta-2 adrenergic receptors, making it the correct medication prescribed for this patient's acute decompensated congestive heart failure. Isoproterenol also targets both beta receptors, but it is not recommended for CHF due to its potential to increase myocardial oxygen demand. Epinephrine and norepinephrine stimulate both beta and alpha receptors, but they are not preferred for CHF treatment.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. In congestive heart failure, the heart is unable to pump enough blood, leading to shortness of breath and edema in the legs. Dobutamine stimulates beta-1 adrenergic receptors and is used to increase cardiac output in acute decompensated heart failure. It has a short half-life of about 2 minutes and its efficacy decreases within one week due to receptor downregulation. Epinephrine and Norepinephrine affect both beta-1 and beta-2 receptors, while Isoproterenol affects beta-2 more than beta-1 receptors.
